topic.title: Goals and objectives of the DITA Open Toolkit
topic.shortdesc: The DITA Open Toolkit is an implementation of the OASIS DITA Technical Committee's specification for DITA DTDs and Schemas. The Toolkit transforms DITA content (maps and topics) into deliverable formats.

body.p: The long term goal of the DITA Open Toolkit is to provide a high quality implementation for production level output of DITA XML content, built in a professionally-managed project environment by vetted contributors, and tested thoroughly for each Release Candidate.

The DITA Open Toolkit provides benefits for different roles of users:
Enterprise users (tools to integrate into end-to-end production pipelines)
Individuals or small business owners (ease of use for very small scale processing applications; interoperable interchange with enterprise consumers)
Consultants (anticipate scenarios for wide range of users; tools to enable consultants to deploy DITA successfully)
Vendors (tested OASIS DTDs and stylesheets for editors, transforms for build tools)
Academic and educational users (demos of key DITA behaviors and best practices).

The 1.0 version of the DITA Open Toolkit project lays the basis with an Ant-driven processing architecture and an initial set of XHTML outputs based on code that has been developed and used within IBM for several years. To enable equally high quality for remaining outputs, the project has additional objectives:

ul.li: Promote the DITA standard in the Information Development community.
Provide a reference implementation of OASIS DITA standard and provide feedback to DITA standard continuously.
Use Open Source techniques to create and maintain DITA transformations.

section.title: Project objectives
section.p: The project will be managed similarly to any commercial software development project, with requirements gathering, plan validation with stakeholders, scheduled activities, tests, reviews, and builds, with an emphasis on quality.

The project will emplace a process for tracking all contributions. Any individual or any organization can contribute, but the spirit of the community is personal contribution. IBM as Committer is desirous that all major contributors get appropriate recognition in press releases, etc..
The DITA Open Toolkit project will track and fix bugs reported against its products, and issue patches based on urgency.

The DITA Open Toolkit project will track to major version updates of the DTDs/Schemas by the OASIS DITA TC by the quarter following the update. Users should stay with the previous toolkit version for stable function while the new features are being built-out and tested.
The DITA Open Toolkit project will track to bug fixes of the DTDs/Schemas by the OASIS DITA TC as necessary (many DTD bug fixes tend to have little impact to tools).
The project agrees with the Open Source motto of "Release early and often" to get wide consensus on issues.
